Case reference: 2014005293.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 20, 1999, Abdol Hossein was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Cheek, Welts all over his face and cheek

Case reference: 2014004801.CaseDesc: Beant Singh Khosa was last seen in Punjab, India on April 15th, 2006.  He travelled to India to attend his father's funeral and never returned.  It is rumored he has returned to Canada, however, his family and friends have not heard from him.

Case reference: 2020008557.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1984, at approximately 10:00 am, Rodolf Scoulde was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Rodolf was on his way to a nearby store.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Sword and heart with the word "COCO"

Case reference: 2014004578.CaseDesc: Donald Tardif was last seen on August 7, 2003. He fell from his boat, a 14-foot motorboat, on Lake Devenyns in the unorganized territories north of St-Michel-des-Saints. Donald has never been seen since.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Calf, Tibia and fibula fragments

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2014006024.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2013, Richard Bailey was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was reported missing by his wife the next day when he failed to return home from work.

Case reference: 2014003839.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1988, George Leslie was seen for the last time at his residence in the city of St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, George was despondent. His vehicle was subsequently located abandoned in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005806.CaseDesc: Roderic Maynard was last seen on Salt Spring Island, BC.  Mr. Maynard had personal issues and departed the area telling friends he intended on attending rehab for treatment of alcohol abuse.  Mr. Maynard is an avid sailor and has travelled all over the world.  Mr. Maynard was employed operating ferries around the Vancouver/Victoria area and would have no problem finding employment operating large water vessels or sail boats.  He is familiar with sailing all around the world and planned to retire in the St. Maarten area.

Mark: Left Cheek, large mole under eye

Case reference: 2018032776.CaseDesc: On Tuesday, June 12 2018, Christian Robinson was seen for the last time leaving his home in the 6th Line and Simcoe Rd. area in the Town of Bradford, Ontario.

Backpack: May have a backpack with unknown contents
Shirt: Grey, Golf, White and yellow pattern on the chest

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.

Case reference: 2006025799.CaseDesc: Anthony Roberts was last seen driving his vehicle east on King Street in Prescott, Ontario, on January 8, 1996. He was reported missing on January 19, 1996, and has not been heard from or seen since that time.

Case reference: 2014003874.CaseDesc: Marthe Turcotte was last seen in Montreal on September 13, 1971. Her sister dropped her off at the Jean-Talon metro station but she was never seen again. Marthe was a student in Nursing at Thetford CEGEP in Thetford Mines.

Case reference: 2020011537.CaseDesc: On February 11, 1985, Veronica Butch was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Veronica had moved out of the apartment that she shared with her boyfriend and she was supposed to move in with her sister, but she never arrived.

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2013000095.CaseDesc: On October 19, 1969 Ronald Bonkowski went fishing with two friends in the Winnipeg River. Upon arriving at their desired location, the party anchored their boat in fast moving water. The anchor caught on the bottom of the river and pulled the boat down, causing it to over turn. All three men were thrown into the water. Two of the men were able to swim to the shore, however Mr. Bonkowski was observed going under the water. The over turned boat was found with an anchor line attached at the dam site. Searches were conducted by water and land, however Ronald Bonkowski was never located. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2014004758.CaseDesc: Brent Bassett was last seen in December 1987 and was living on his boat that had no engine at West Bay Marina in Esquimalt, British Columbia. Mr. Bassett struggled with cognitive issues and was known to be friendly and trusting. Mr. Bassett  collected bottles from other people in the Marina for spending money and worked at the Salvation Army Thrift Store.

Case reference: 2013000054.CaseDesc: On December 28, 2006, Carlisle Callum-Drummond was seen for the last time in the Cotes-des-Neiges -Notre-Dame-de-Grace district of Montreal, Quebec. Carlisle left from his home and it is possible that he may be with his father, who is also missing.

Case reference: 2008006798.CaseDesc: Jason Russell was last seen at the Casino in Niagara Falls. Mr. Russell was a student at Brock University in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020089.CaseDesc: Michel Guy Favreau lived alone in Nipawin, Saskatchewan at the time of his disappearance. Michel suffered from depression and he was last heard from and seen between September 22nd and September 25th, 2011. On October 4th, 2011 his vehicle, a 1998 green Chrysler Intrepid, was located abandoned at Carroll's Cove camp ground near Nipawin. Several searches were conducted in hopes of locating him were unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014005339.CaseDesc: Gilles Lacroix, a priest, was last seen on August 31, 2009 in Boucherville. He was living in Longueuil. He left in his vehicle. His vehicle was found September 5, 2009.

Case reference: 2014006306.CaseDesc: Shelly Dene was reported missing to the EPS by a family member on November 8, 2013. She had been out of family contact since approximately August 2013. Family is concerned for her welfare as it is unusual for her to be out of contact for this length of time. Shelly resided in Kelowna BC before moving to Edmonton in June 2013.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2014005323.CaseDesc: Darrell Hoshowski was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta, in July 1983. Prior to his disappearance, Darrell had made a withdrawal from his bank account. There is reason to believe that he may have travelled, and Vancouver, British Columbia and California were mentioned as being possible destinations.

Case reference: 2017076317.CaseDesc: Dakota Anzovino was last seen on December 23, 2017, in the City of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Boots: Tan, Black, Winter, Brand: "Sorel"; with white fur
Jacket: Black, Grey, Plaid with dark hood
Jeans: Denim, Grey, Light Blue, Or grey in colour

Case reference: 2018045820.CaseDesc: On November 7, 1994, at approximately 1:30 pm, Subarangit Rajanehru was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006000199.CaseDesc: October 26, 1986, an unidentified man was found under the ramp to the Gardiner Expressway and Spadina Avenue behind 252 Queens Quay West, in Toronto, Ontario. He was well-nourished, and was found not wearing any clothing.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Male pattern baldness, 4mm facial stubble
Mark: Left Elbow, Small mole on the side of his left elbow

Case reference: 2016068328.CaseDesc: This male foot was found washed up on the shore of Gull Island in Presqu'ile Provincial Park. The foot was inside a black "PUMA" ankle sock and a size 11 women's "Mizuno Wave Prophecy" running shoe. The shoe was first available for sale in Spring 2011. The post-mortem interval is anywhere from one month to 2 and a half years.

Case reference: 2013000139.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Clayton Condos. He was last seen on March 20, 2006, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020179.CaseDesc: This adult Caucasian female was recovered from a freight yard north of 127 Water Street. in Vancouver.

Case reference: 2023001230.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2023, John Michael Fongémie was last seen. Since that time, no bank transactions have been recorded, nor have any calls been made on his cell phone. Extensive searches for John Michael were conducted with no success.

Tattoo: Right Leg, Yin Yang symbol, yellow and blue
Upper Left Back, Two initials, possibly "G" and "J"

Case reference: 2017044551.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2017, at approximately 1:00pm, Mark Trizanto was last seen near Roncesvalles Avenue and the Queensway in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2005000899.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2005, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 29 and 50, was found in a wooded area on the embankment of a small creek off Queen Street in Bobcaygeon, Ontario. There are indications that this person suffered from early age-related osteoarthritis. It is believed that this individual had likely been at this location since 1994 or earlier.

Case reference: 2014001012.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2001, the skull of a man was discovered in a rural area near Mineral's Road in the town of Conception Bay South, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2008004899.CaseDesc: Fernand Martin, also known as Fernand Boutin, last seen on the 24th April, 1964 when he visited the outpost at the north end of the Pakashkan Lake.  He was tending to his traplines in the bush near Pakashkan Lake.

Jacket: Animal Skin, light doe skin jacket
Shirt: size 33 shirt with a 15.5 inch neck

Case reference: 2014004699.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2005, Veeravi Jeya Eskimuttu "VJ", was last seen leaving his place of employment in Saint John, NB. He is known to be transient and has lived in Toronto, Cornwall, Montreal and Halifax.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2020007343.CaseDesc: Marie Lyons had been living with her aunt after she had fled from her abusive husband. On April 12, 1971, Marie was last seen when her husband picked her up from her aunt’s residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shoes: Brown, Laced; Low cut with laces

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006023099.CaseDesc: Gordon Zeigler was last seen on January 3, 1991, heading to a camp on Elizabeth Lake, Ontario by snowmobile. Although his snowmobile was located on Lake Nipigon, he was never found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014006329.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2013, David Czerman was taken to Surrey Memorial Hospital for substance impairment.  Later that day, David discharged himself from the hospital and was given a bus ticket at approximately 19:40 hours. He has not been seen by his neighbours or family since November 21, 2013.  David Czerman was depressed and on pain medication for a medical condition.  Family described Mr. Czerman as a recluse, with no friends and only left his residence to go to the local pharmacy as he had trouble walking.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Dragon, Rose, bones skull
Left Forearm, Smurf, eagle, worm, heart
Right Forearm, Wizard, devil, rose, bird

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2014002147.CaseDesc: On September 22nd, 1981 Churchill RCMP received a call from Mrs. Esmoil advising her two sons, and two friends were late on returning from a canoe trip. On August 18th, 1981, Brian Dean Esmoil, his brother, and two friends headed out on an extended canoe trip from Leaf Rapids to Churchill. Numerous items, belonging to the men were found on shore. The bodies of three of the four travelers were recovered on the Churchilll River and death was due to drowning. The body of Brian Esmoil has never been recovered and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2015061728.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 25, 1967, Alphonse Brochu left his residence to deliver documents to a government agency in Ottawa, Ontario. That same day, Mr. Brochu’s vehicle was located on the Champlain Bridge, which connects Ottawa to Gatineau, Quebec.

Boots: Black, Rubber on the toe area
Shoes: Black, Rubber on the toe area

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2014004474.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1987, Lillian Kotyk was last seen when she left her home in Edmonton, Alberta. Lillian has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014000001.CaseDesc: Emma Fillipoff was last seen in the Victoria Inner Harbour area on November 28, 2012.  She was reported to be a shy and quiet person and had been staying at a local shelter for about 6 months prior to her going missing. It is believed that Emma may have been suffering from the onset of some mental health issues. She was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes.  Emma did not use or abuse drugs or alcohol.

Luggage: Canvas, Other, Light coloured canvas bag
Shoes: Blue, Grey, Was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes

Case reference: 2020013402.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2020, Vincent Turcotte was for the last time in the Parc des Berges area of Clermont, Quebec. The bike he was riding was found near the Malbaie River.

Hair: Auburn, Short, Sports a moustache and a little beard
Shoes: Light Green, NIKE AIRJO, "Nike Air Jordan" brand, camouflage
Sweater: Black, Green, HOODIE, Hooded sweatshirt, text "Les Beaux Projects"
Tattoo: Right Hand, Unknown text on fingers

Case reference: 2019016353.CaseDesc: On March 13th 2019 Michael Steele was seen for the last time at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital Emergency Department.

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2014045101.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an older adult female were found near Chasm, British Colombia in 2010. She had no teeth in her lower jaw and had likely gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2019056482.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 26, 2019, Gregory Paul Agnew was seen for the last time in his green Pontiac Sunfire, leaving a mushroom picker’s camp located at the 11km mark on the Kinsckutch Forest Service Road in New Aiyansh, to run errands in Terrace, British Columbia. On the evening of September 27, 2019, the Pontiac Sunfire was observed at his campsite along with his camper van, but Gregory was not there. An extensive search of the area was conducted with no success. Gregory has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005390.CaseDesc: On November 10,  2009, Victoria Chan was seen for the last time in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Victoria was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2012020117.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1995, Chantal Picotte was reported missing by her mother. Chantal was last seen on the evening of Wednesday, November 22, 1995 at a bar in Saint-Jérôme, Quebec.  She had called her mother that evening asking her to come see her. The next day, Chantal's mother went to her daughter’s residence, but Chantal was not there. The mother made several attempts to call her daughter without any success.

Case reference: 2014006178.CaseDesc: An investigation revealed that nobody had seen or heard from Alex Klym since the mid 1970's. The family had made attempts to locate Alex, but they were unsuccessful and nobody ever reported that he was missing. Inquiries were made with various government agencies in an attempt to find some evidence of him after the mid 1970's. There is no trace of him. The body of Alex Klym has never been recovered. It is not known what happened to Alex, but foul play cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2017065923.CaseDesc: Oleg Chmelev was last seen at his home in the area of Morning Star Drive and Brandon Gate Drive, Mississauga, on October 30, 2017. His green bicycle was also missing and was his main mode of transportation.

Case reference: 2014002519.CaseDesc: Mr. Beauchamps was last seen on April 18, 1977 in Montreal. Mr.Beauchamps went to his sister's house after an argument with his boyfriend. He stayed there for a few days, and then left without giving any more news.

Case reference: 2008023299.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of June 30, 2001, Istefan Toma returned home after work. He showered, changed his clothes and was observed leaving the family home at approximately 1 a.m. in his own vehicle. It was later discovered he had taken his identification and citizenship card, but did not take any clothing or other belongings with him. His vehicle was recovered from a parking lot in the vicinity of his work place at Woodbridge Mall (Hwy 7/Martingrove, Woodbridge, Ontario) on the 11th of February 2002, having been parked there for approximately 6-9 months. Mr. Toma has not been in contact with any family members nor his employers since he left his home on the morning of June 30, 2001. Mr. Toma speaks broken English, is known to smoke DuMaurier cigarettes and has been known to attend casinos on occasion. Mr. Toma's family and the police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Mark: Nose, Mole on the right side of the nose

Case reference: 2014000003.CaseDesc: The Toronto Police Service is seeking assistance in solving a missing person case.  Mr. Sandhu left his home located in the North West area of Toronto in February of 2004 and never returned.  His family is desperately seeking answers.  Please contact the Toronto Police Service with any information that may assist in locating Mr. Sandhu.

Jacket: Cotton, Black, waist length; zippered front
Scar: Nose, Small scar on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2014003825.CaseDesc: Ruby Ann Hardy was reported missing by her brother in 2002. She was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver in June 1997, and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014000008.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2008, Christopher Hargitt, a resident of Vernon, BC, drove from Vernon to Vancouver. He was last seen by an associate, who was dropped off by Mr. Hargitt near the PNE Fairgrounds. On March 6, 2008, Christopher's vehicle was found unoccupied in East Vancouver, and he has made no contact with family or friends since that time. It is believed that Christopher may have run afoul of individuals involved in criminal activity, or fled the country to avoid these same persons.

Case reference: 2012020060.CaseDesc: Rene Mazerolle was last seen on July 28, 2008 when he was discharged from the Health Sciences Centre in Winnipeg.  Mr. Mazerolle's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2006024399.CaseDesc: Mark Cornett was last seen at Missinaibi Lake, 1.0 kilometre north of Fairy Point in Missinaibi Township. He was involved in a boating accident on his way back from fishing and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014005016.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2007, Jason Adam was seen for the last time near the Shaw Conference Center in Edmonton, Alberta. Jason left a family member’s residence on foot to meet with an ex-girlfriend for coffee. On the previous day, Jason had traveled from Lac La Biche, Alberta to Edmonton to attend a guardianship court hearing on October 22, 2007, but he never showed up.

Case reference: 2020008538.CaseDesc: In mid-June 1976, Peter Vollar was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario. Peter had advised he was heading to London, Ontario for two weeks to seek job opportunities. All of his personal belongings were left behind.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2014003305.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1987, Wade Stanley Saxton was seen for the last time as he left his residence in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006019799.CaseDesc: Anthony Evans was last seen on Jarvis Lake on June 12, 1984.  He fell from the boat he was in and his body has not been recovered.

Boots: Leather, Brown, Steel toe work boots

Case reference: 2014001859.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1997, Wendy Ratte was reported missing by her daughter. Mrs. Ratte was last seen on August 18, at 3pm. Her vehicle was found, locked, in a grocery store parking lot. Investigations led to a conviction in 2010, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2013000138.CaseDesc: Peter Limberis was last seen in Trail BC on July 20, 2005. He left Trail on his way to Saskatchewan, driving in his white 2003 Saturn Vue with Saskatchewan licence plate 850ENA. Mr. Limberis was also travelling with his dog, a white and brown smooth haired Fox Terrier named Pedro.

Chain: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, chain
Pants: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Track
Shirt: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Jersey
Watch: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Jail house noose

Case reference: 2015066612.CaseDesc: On December 7, 2015, Sheree Fertuck was seen for the last time driving a red 1998 International semi truck and trailer near Kenaston, Saskatchewan. The following morning her semi was located with several personal items inside it, including her cellular phone, keys and jacket.

Case reference: 2014005193.CaseDesc: Margaret Schwabe was last seen at her home in East St. Paul, Manitoba. She has not been seen since.

Hair: Grey, Wavy, Short, Hair was dyed dark brown with a red undertone
Teeth: Full upper dentures and a partial dental plate on lower jaw

Case reference: 2009003899.CaseDesc: Investigation revealed that Emile Ruger, who resides on Brookdale Ave., had not paid his rent for the month of March and April 2008.  Mr. Ruger usually pays his rent three days in advance to the month due. He was last seen mid-February 2008 and his whereabouts are unknown. Last Seen: Rooming House on Brookdale Avenue

Case reference: 2010001199.CaseDesc: Michael Hinsperger was in a canoe on Carson Lake, Barry's Bay, at 3:00 P.M. on May 13th 2010. The canoe was recovered but Mr. Hinsperger has not been located.

Jacket: Black, Yellow lettering "Harley Davidson Owners club"

Case reference: 2015050774.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2015, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Mazen Malik was last seen in the Sheppard Avenue West and Allen Road area in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006022699.CaseDesc: Nick Hibbart was prospecting when he was last seen by police at his camp on Gravel River on June 8, 1988. Police returned to the area on July 25, 1988, and found that the camp was burned to the ground. There was no sign of Mr. Hibbart and investigations have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2011000299.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2010, the skeletal remains of a Caucasian male were found in the forest near Chemin Lac Clair in West Nipissing, Ontario. He is believed to have been there from two weeks to six months.

Hair: Brown, Short, Shorter than collar length
Teeth: Some dental work and some untreated dental disease
Other: Signs of arthritis in his feet. Bandages on them suggesting that he may have experienced pain

Case reference: 2014004013.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1997, Eric Pouliot said he was departing to go up north for a maximum of 48 hours, but he never returned. He had little money and no vehicle. At the time of his disappearance, Eric lived in the LeMoyne district of Longueuil, Quebec for one week.

Case reference: 2014002914.CaseDesc: Edward Allan Street was last seen at his rooming house on Columbia St in Kamloops, BC.  At around 8:30 am on March 4, 2000, Edward told his friends that he was quickly dropping by his place of work but would be back in time for a meeting at 10:00 am.  His wallet and ID were left inside his room.

Amputation: Right Ring Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle
Right Middle Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Foot, Broken foot as a child

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2014001281.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1982, a volunteer with Meals on Wheels reported to the police that, despite numerous attempts, they had not been able to contact Thelma Haskins. Police checked her home, however she was not there and they found nothing suspicious.  None of Mrs. Haskins' friends had seen her, and she had not frequented any local businesses.  Ground searches of the area and of the walking trails Mrs. Haskins frequented did not reveal any trace of her.  Mrs. Haskins has not been located.

Hair: Black, Short, hair is turning grey

Case reference: 2014005807.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2012, Marc St-Laurent was seen for the last time on a bench outside the grocery store at Place Quévillon in Lebel-sur-Quévillon, Quebec. His pick-up, a white 1992 GMC Sierra, was located on 26 July 2012, in a federated snowmobile trail, approximately three kilometres from Lebel-sur-Quévillon.

Case reference: 2019052572.CaseDesc: On January 1, 1995, Bojan Stamenkovic was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Following his arrival to Canada from Serbia, Bojan was employed as a mechanical engineer, and a professor at the University of Toronto. Around the time of his disappearance, Bojan had informed his family that he would not be able to contact them for an extended period of time due to unknown reasons.

Case reference: 2014006339.CaseDesc: Karen Kozicki was reported missing on May 13, 1996, after she failed to return home from place of employment in Edmonton, Alberta. Karen's vehicle was located on June 23, 1996, near Hanmore Lake, near the town of Smokey Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001814.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1973, between 2:00pm and 5:00pm Steve Mysick packed a suitcase and left the residence where he was staying, located in Rapid City, Manitoba. Steve Mysick was an outpatient of the Brandon Mental Hospital and had been staying with his friends for 2.5 years at the time of his disappearance.   Mr. Mysick was last seen at the CP train station in Brandon, Manitoba. It is likely Mr. Mysick purchased the ticket to Winnipeg as he had very limited funds available and had lived in Winnipeg in the past. There is no indication if Mr. Mysick actually boarded the train to Winnipeg.   Steve Mysick has never been located and his whereabouts is unknown. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014006505.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2014, Sandra Mensah was seen for the last time in the Cartierville district of Montreal, Quebec. Her boyfriend came to pick her up at her home during the evening. Sandra has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020078.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1990, Anthony Whitehead was last seen at a party on the Gordon's First Nation, SK. Searches and investigation over the years have failed to locate Mr. Whitehead.

Tattoo: Skull with hat on one arm, unknown which arm
Left Hand, Phyllis Bluecloud covered to look like a bar
Middle Back, Skull and dragon, others

Case reference: 2014003434.CaseDesc: On the evening of May 18, 1986, Monique Brosseau was seen for the last time at her home in Duhamel-Ouest, Quebec.

Case reference: 2018062818.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1993, at approximately 1:30am, Rafat Abugazia was last seen by his roommate in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003051.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1991, Yannick Fortin, age 6, was last seen playing by himself in the backyard of the family residence in Matawin. The backyard of the house overlooks the St. Maurice River. Searches were conducted in the area but Yannick was never seen again.

Case reference: 2014004988.CaseDesc: Margaret Blackbird was last seen in Loon Lake, Saskatchewan in 1951. It had been suspected that Ms. Blackbird left for either Alberta or British Columbia; however, she made no further contact with her family. Inquiries to locate Ms. Blackbird in Alberta and British Columbia have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2014003770.CaseDesc: Herbert Gross was to meet his girlfriend for lunch on May 4, 1996. He failed to show up, which was extremely out of character for him. On May 7th, a man described as being Caucasian, in his mid-20s, 5'7 and 140-150 lbs, clean shaven with short, brown hair, was seen moving items from Mr. Gross's suite. This man was wearing a dark shirt, faded jeans and white runners. Police feel Mr. Gross may have been the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2019038949.CaseDesc: On May 8, 2019, Calvin Brown was last seen at his home in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Calvin boarded a flight to Jamaica and was scheduled to return on May 20, but has not returned home.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022018590.CaseDesc: Xiao Hua Jiang, who goes by her English name “Christina”, was last seen at approximately 1am on April 27, 2022 in West Vancouver, British Columbia. On May 2, 2022, her vehicle, a grey 2021 Toyota Highlander was located abandoned on Highway 1, approximately 20 kilometres east of Rogers Pass, just outside Glacier National Park in British Columbia. The vehicle had sustained mechanical damage rendering it undriveable. Xiao Hua has not been seen or heard from since.
